question:
Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off towards the trees and them make a left. flat towards the tree on the corner and land. fly over the buildings and bear left. follow the path to the tall building on height then turn right. fly upwards over the billboard. fly over the first tall building then to the next and go left around it. make a left and fly back past the tall buildings on your left. make a right and go downwards to the building on the corner by the water. when over the building turn right towards the water. turn left and follow the path in front of the building next to the water.]. At the initial position, you are following a series of movement instructions. What are you doing now?  
choose:  
A. I fly over the first tall building, then fly to the next one and go left around it.  
B. I follow the path to the tall building above, then turn right.  
C. I turn left and fly back, passing the tall building on the left.  
D. I turn left toward the water.  
E. I turn left and follow the path in front of the waterside building.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: E; Reason: The current view shows a path alongside a building next to the water, which aligns with the instruction to "turn left and follow the path in front of the building next to the water." This is the final step in the given navigation instructions, indicating that this is the current action being performed.

These views align with the instruction to "turn left and follow the path in front of the building next to the water." This is the final step in the given navigation instructions, indicating that this is the current action being performed.
